titleStmt.title: Frank Waters to George W. Johnson
CWG14401

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Lex. Ky. July 8. 1861
Geo W Johnson Esqr
Scott Co. Ky.
Dear Sir.

Yours of a day or two since was received. Mr R Higgins cannot of course agree to any arbitrament without the consent of J. A. Higgins who is now South taking the depositions according to notice served upon you. As the lawyer of both J A & R Higgins I will say to you that your proviso as to an agreement of facts is impossible and even if the case is arbitrated evidence will have to be taken as if ni court -- There is however plenty of time between this and Nov and without giving
any decided answer now both of us can go on taking sproof and if we then agree we can select arbitrators --
